docs.title: Installation
docs.text:
1. Clone the repository: sh git clone https://github.com/grasp-labs/ds-event-stream-python-sdk.git cd ds-event-stream-python-sdk

  2. Set up a Python virtual environment: sh python3 -m venv .venv source .venv/bin/activate

  3. Install dependencies: sh pip install -r requirements.txt # Or use 'uv pip install -r requirements.txt' if using uv

  4. (Optional) Generate models from schemas: sh make generate-models

A Python SDK for producing and consuming events on a Kafka-based event stream, following Grasp Labs' event stream conventions.

docs.title: Features
docs.text:
• Dataclass Models: Auto-generated from JSON schemas for type-safe event handling.
  • Kafka Producer/Consumer Services: Simple interfaces for sending and receiving events.
  • Service Principal Configuration: Centralized config via KafkaConfig for authentication and connection settings.
  • Mockable for Testing: All Kafka interactions can be mocked for CI and local testing.

docs.title: Package Structure
docs.text:
dseventstream/
    models/
        event.py           # Event dataclass (auto-generated)
        system_topics.py   # System topics enum (auto-generated)
    kafka/
        kafka_service.py   # Producer/Consumer service classes
        kafka_config.py    # Shared config for Kafka principals

docs.title: 1. Configure Kafka Connection
docs.text:
from dseventstream.kafka.kafka_config import KafkaConfig
config = KafkaConfig(
    bootstrap_servers="kafka-prod:9092",
    username="service-principal",
    password="secret"
)

docs.title: 2. Create Producer/Consumer
docs.text:
from dseventstream.kafka.kafka_service import KafkaProducerService, KafkaConsumerService
producer = KafkaProducerService(config=config)
consumer = KafkaConsumerService(config=config, group_id="my-group")

docs.title: 3. Send an Event
docs.text:
from dseventstream.models.event import Event
event = Event(
    id="event-id",
    session_id="session-id",
    request_id="request-id",
    tenant_id="tenant-id",
    event_type="type",
    event_source="source",
    metadata={"key": "value"},
    timestamp="2025-09-18T00:00:00Z",
    created_by="user",
    md5_hash="..."
)
producer.send("topic-name", event)

docs.title: 4. Consume Events
docs.text:
def on_message(event_dict):
    print(event_dict)
consumer.consume("topic-name", on_message)

docs.title: Testing
docs.text:
• All Kafka interactions are mockable using unittest.mock.
  • Example tests are provided in the tests/ folder.

docs.title: Security
docs.text: • SASL_PLAINTEXT and SCRAM-SHA-512 are used for authentication (see KafkaConfig).

docs.title: Auto-Generated Models
docs.text: • Models are generated from JSON schemas in the schemas/ folder using the Makefile.

docs.title: License
docs.text: MIT

docs.title: dseventstream.kafka.kafka_config.KafkaConfig
docs.text:
• Centralized configuration for Kafka service principals.
  • Hardcoded: security_protocol=SASL_PLAINTEXT, sasl_mechanism=SCRAM-SHA-512
  • Parameters:
  • bootstrap_servers: Kafka broker address
  • username: SASL username
  • password: SASL password
  • extra: Optional dict for additional config
  • Method: to_dict() returns config for Kafka clients

docs.title: dseventstream.kafka.kafka_service.KafkaProducerService
docs.text:
• Constructor: KafkaProducerService(config: KafkaConfig)
  • Method: send(topic: str, event: Event, key: Optional[str] = None)

docs.title: dseventstream.kafka.kafka_service.KafkaConsumerService
docs.text:
• Constructor: KafkaConsumerService(config: KafkaConfig, group_id: str)
  • Method: consume(topic: str, on_message: Callable[[Any], None])

docs.title: dseventstream.models.event.Event
docs.text: • Auto-generated dataclass for event payloads

docs.title: dseventstream.models.system_topics.EventID
docs.text: • Auto-generated enum for system topics

docs.title: Mocking Kafka
docs.text:
All Kafka producer and consumer interactions can be mocked using unittest.mock.

Example:

from unittest.mock import patch, MagicMock
from dseventstream.kafka.kafka_service import KafkaProducerService
from dseventstream.kafka.kafka_config import KafkaConfig

@patch("dseventstream.kafka.kafka_service.Producer")
def test_send_event(mock_producer_class):
    mock_producer = MagicMock()
    mock_producer_class.return_value = mock_producer
    config = KafkaConfig(bootstrap_servers="localhost:9092")
    producer = KafkaProducerService(config=config)
    # ...

docs.title: Running Tests
docs.text:
Run all tests:

python -m unittest discover -s tests

docs.title: CI/CD
docs.text:
• Tests do not require a running Kafka broker.
  • See tests/ for examples.

docs.title: Kafka Configuration
docs.text:
Configure your Kafka connection using KafkaConfig:

from dseventstream.kafka.kafka_config import KafkaConfig
config = KafkaConfig(
    bootstrap_servers="kafka-prod:9092",
    username="service-principal",
    password="secret"
)

docs.title: Producer/Consumer
docs.text:
Create producer and consumer services:

from dseventstream.kafka.kafka_service import KafkaProducerService, KafkaConsumerService
producer = KafkaProducerService(config=config)
consumer = KafkaConsumerService(config=config, group_id="my-group")

docs.title: Sending Events
docs.text:
from dseventstream.models.event import Event
event = Event(
    id="event-id",
    session_id="session-id",
    request_id="request-id",
    tenant_id="tenant-id",
    event_type="type",
    event_source="source",
    metadata={"key": "value"},
    timestamp="2025-09-18T00:00:00Z",
    created_by="user",
    md5_hash="..."
)
producer.send("topic-name", event)

docs.title: Consuming Events
docs.text:
def on_message(event_dict):
    print(event_dict)
consumer.consume("topic-name", on_message)
